bibdata.title: Implement submit collection on new publishing profile.
Scanned map resource does not have coverage_display

comments.body:
When looking at the Alma record, it appears that the 034 subfield e has an invisible character that makes it not a valid coordinate format. This only became apparent when pasting the value into an editor

![image.png](https://images.zenhubusercontent.com/5d51624a5b89150001ae0b03/dc3cba40-10d0-4ac6-a10e-ca88713c58ba)

A cataloger should correct the record, and it should be caught in the next incremental. @eliotjordan
The record was corrected at 4:15 PM, so it should be in the 10 PM publishing job.

figgy.title: Generate report for any and all Cotsen Items within the Digital Repository

comments.body:
As indicated in Section I-c of 2023-04-Feedback-to-Cotsen-Figgy-report.gdoc, the current report can’t seem to capture all Cotsen items in Figgy. 

> cotsen_report: 1241 items
> Figgy collection “Lloyd E. Cotsen”: 1598 members


Note the discrepancy of 1598-1241=357 items between the Figgy collection “Lloyd E. Cotsen” and cotsen_report.csv.

For the next report, could I obtain all items that are currently members of the following four collections? I would like to wait till _after_ the [suggested changes](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1Zgyi9k2HXiouXn1qgkV_ek6a6ULLn55megVXmdZmUXY/edit?usp=share_link) have been made for the second report.

1. Lloyd E. Cotsen
2. Cotsen Children's Library
3. Cotsen (Welcome Additions Exhibition)
4. Soviet Era Books for Children and Youth

The fields needed are listed in Section II, or repeated here--

1. Id
2. Title
3. Collections
4. File count
5. Depositor
6. Visibility
7. Extent
8. Identifier
9. Date
10. Local identifier
11. Portion note
12. Source metadata identifier
13. Call number
14. Location
15. Downloadable

Thanks!
Minjie
This looks like a duplicate of #24

orangelight.title: Test Blacklight 8 Upgrade with Unapi Gem

comments.body: Zotero is something the librarians teach in their instruction workshops and I think based past feedback from librarians is pretty widely used particularly in the humanities/social sciences graduate students. To test this you need to install the Zotero desktop and the Zotero "connector" add-on for the browser you are using. The connector will scrap metadata off both the search results and the individual record page by clicking the add-on icon in the browser. ![Screenshot 2023-04-17 at 8.27.33 AM.png](https://images.zenhubusercontent.com/5cba088397df763a9090ce23/531ab53a-7459-4ee9-8053-c74b810dce14)
On the record page:![Screenshot 2023-04-17 at 8.48.40 AM.png](https://images.zenhubusercontent.com/5cba088397df763a9090ce23/5bfe000a-7a8d-4892-bb8f-c8052a419dae)
![Screenshot 2023-04-17 at 8.48.58 AM.png](https://images.zenhubusercontent.com/5cba088397df763a9090ce23/e710d19f-8737-4e92-b992-7b9f7f7d5e2f)

The dialog for search results shows all records displayed on the page:![Screenshot 2023-04-17 at 8.50.45 AM.png](https://images.zenhubusercontent.com/5cba088397df763a9090ce23/ed6baf9c-4654-4c87-9e24-8c0714ec811a)
I have this set-up and working if you pick up this issue ping me we can go through a test.

orangelight.title: Upgrade Range Limit Plugin to 8.3 or above
MapSet records have a viewer per sheet

comments.body: [This documentation of the figgy integration](https://github.com/pulibrary/orangelight/blob/main/docs/orangelight-figgy.md) will be helpful for whoever is looking at this ticket.

I deployed to [catalog-staging](https://catalog-staging.princeton.edu/). I looked into the syslog in both catalog-staging1 and 2. there is only one error from sneakers but it triggered only once. 
Stopping orangelight-sneakers...
Apr 17 14:01:50 catalog-staging2 sneakers[22769]: Unexpected error undefined method `each' for nil:NilClass
Apr 17 14:01:50 catalog-staging2 sneakers[22769]:     thread.backtrace.each {|bt|
Apr 17 14:01:50 catalog-staging2 sneakers[22769]:                     ^^^^^


Did you deploy the branch successfully on Friday?
I tried catalog-qa as well because we track honeybadger errors but can't see sth meaningful so far. checked syslog, lastlog and alma_qa.log

It looks like there is an [error in the nginx logs](https://app.datadoghq.com/logs?query=service%3Aorangelight%20status%3Ainfo&cols=host%2Cservice&event=AgAAAYePuFjxmpoksgAAAAAAAAAYAAAAAEFZZVB1R05CQUFBa0xRQmRfTVdBRGdBQQAAACQAAAAAMDE4NzhmYjgtNmNhZS00ZGJkLTliYzUtMTczZTVkNTc4NjE5&index=%2A&messageDisplay=inline&stream_sort=desc&viz=stream&from_ts=1681742211070&to_ts=1681743111070&live=true) -- thanks for catching this, @christinach !

orangelight.title: Deprecation warning: Calling show_fields_for with a scalar value is deprecated

comments.body:
It looks like this is being raised because `document['format']` for https://catalog.princeton.edu/catalog/SCSB-7935196 is nil. It seems wrong that the format would be nil - should we ever expect to get nil for format?

I'm trying to figure out how to see what we're getting from SCSB for that record, and why the format might be nil - we might need to change something in Bibdata as well. - SCSB record https://scsb.recaplib.org/openMarcRecord?bibId=7935196
See https://github.com/pulibrary/bibdata/issues/2134 for ticket for work without format

orangelight.title: At 125% zoom or higher publication year input is obscured on advanced search form

comments.body: This is also an accessibility issue: [WCAG says that you need to be able to zoom text up to 200%](https://www.w3.org/TR/UNDERSTANDING-WCAG20/visual-audio-contrast-scale.html) without loss of content or functionality.

orangelight.title: Upgrade Blacklight-Marc Gem to latest commit (a463221)
Scanned map resource bounding box is not being generated in json-ld view

comments.body:
The example jsonld does not have a `coverage` property because the object's Solr record does not have a `coverage_display` property. ([working record solr doc](https://catalog.princeton.edu/catalog/9977102743506421/raw), [not working record solr doc](https://catalog.princeton.edu/catalog/9941463973506421/raw))

See [ticket in Bibdata](https://github.com/pulibrary/bibdata/issues/2135)

orangelight.title: Review Deprecation Warnings in Current Blacklight 7 Release Branch

comments.body:
One deprecation is coming from the Advanced Search gem, which we are working on upgrading in a separate ticket (#3412):
```
       DEPRECATION WARNING: default_search_field is deprecated and will be removed from a future release (Use Blacklight::Configuration#default_search_field). (called from add_advanced_parse_q_to_solr at /Users/kadelm/.asdf/installs/ruby/3.1.0/lib/ruby/gems/3.1.0/gems/blacklight_advanced_search-7.0.0/lib/blacklight_advanced_search/advanced_search_builder.rb:54)
```

Remove the deprecation from the advanced search gem leaves only one deprecation (based on running the test suite)

```
  5) search requests for the catalog atom feed renders the page
     Failure/Error: xml.link    'rel' => 'alternate', 'type' => 'text/html', 'href' => polymorphic_url(url_for_document(document))

     ActionView::Template::Error:
       DEPRECATION WARNING: url_for_document is deprecated and will be removed from a future release (Use SearchState#url_for_document directly). (called from block in _app_views_catalog__document_default_atom_builder___2992284612096802835_1514880 at /Users/kadelm/projects/orangelight/app/views/catalog/_document_default.atom.builder:9)
     # ./app/views/catalog/_document_default.atom.builder:9:in `block in _app_views_catalog__document_default_atom_builder___2992284612096802835_1514880'
     # ./app/views/catalog/_document_default.atom.builder:3:in `_app_views_catalog__document_default_atom_builder___2992284612096802835_1514880'
     # ./app/controllers/catalog_controller.rb:689:in `index'
     # ./lib/orangelight/middleware/invalid_parameter_handler.rb:12:in `call'
     # ./spec/requests/catalog_spec.rb:38:in `block (3 levels) in <top (required)>'
     # ------------------
     # --- Caused by: ---
     # RuntimeError:
     #   DEPRECATION WARNING: url_for_document is deprecated and will be removed from a future release (Use SearchState#url_for_document directly). (called from block in _app_views_catalog__document_default_atom_builder___2992284612096802835_1514880 at /Users/kadelm/projects/orangelight/app/views/catalog/_document_default.atom.builder:9)
     #   ./app/views/catalog/_document_default.atom.builder:9:in `block in _app_views_catalog__document_default_atom_builder___2992284612096802835_1514880'
```

It looks like we overrode these partials a good while ago, and the implementation in Blacklight has drifted a good bit since.

pdc_discovery.title: Possible caching issue when using widgets to filter
Clean up Solr collections in production

comments.body:
Final status:
* Recreated collection `pdc-discovery-production-1` with two replicas. 
* Alias `pdc-discovery-production` points to this new collection.
* Deleted collection `pdc-discovery-production-3` that had only one replica (not needed now that figured out the reindex issue, see PR #419).
* Deleted collection `pdc-discovery-production-2` since it was created just for testing.

Another approach that we could consider is to create a new collection during indexing and index to the new collection. Swap the old with the new collection (via an alias). 

This new approach gives us both: a clean slate _and_ minimizes the chances that user will see partial changes to the index.
superseded by #3793
ran this successfully on adc{1,2}
